SEARCH
Package icyllis.modernui.graphics.font

Class GlyphManager

java.lang.Object
icyllis.modernui.graphics.font.GlyphManager
public class GlyphManager extends Object
Manages all glyphs, font atlases, measures glyph metrics and draw them of different sizes and styles, and upload them to generated OpenGL textures.
See Also:
  • GLFontAtlas
  • FontCollection

  • Field Details

    • MARKER

      public static final org.apache.logging.log4j.Marker MARKER

    • GLYPH_BORDER

      public static final int GLYPH_BORDER
      The width in pixels of a transparent border between individual glyphs in the atlas. This border keeps neighboring glyphs from "bleeding through" when mipmap used.

      Additional notes: two pixels because we may use SDF to stroke.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • sAntiAliasing

      public static volatile boolean sAntiAliasing
      Config values. Bitmap-like fonts, with anti aliasing and high precision OFF. This may require additional reviews on pixel alignment.

    • sFractionalMetrics

      public static volatile boolean sFractionalMetrics

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      @NonNull public static GlyphManager getInstance()

    • reload

      @RenderThread public void reload()
      Reload the glyph manager, clear all created textures.

    • layoutGlyphVector

      @NonNull public GlyphVector layoutGlyphVector(@NonNull Font awtFont, @NonNull char[] text, int start, int limit, boolean isRtl)
      Given a font, perform full text layout/shaping and create a new GlyphVector for a text.
      Parameters:
      text - the U16 text to layout
      start - the offset into text at which to start the layout
      limit - the (offset + length) at which to stop performing the layout
      isRtl - whether the text should layout right-to-left
      Returns:
      the newly laid-out GlyphVector

    • createGlyphVector

      @NonNull public GlyphVector createGlyphVector(@NonNull Font awtFont, @NonNull char[] text)
      Create glyph vector without text shaping, which means by mapping characters to glyphs one-to-one.
      Parameters:
      text - the U16 text to layout
      Returns:
      the newly created GlyphVector

    • lookupGlyph

      @Nullable @RenderThread public BakedGlyph lookupGlyph(@NonNull Font font, int fontSize, int glyphId)
      Given a font and a glyph ID within that font, locate the glyph's pre-rendered image in the glyph atlas and return its cache entry. The entry stores the texture with the pre-rendered glyph image, as well as the position and size of that image within the texture.
      Parameters:
      font - the font (with style) to which this glyph ID belongs and which was used to pre-render the glyph
      fontSize - the font size in device space
      glyphId - the font specific glyph ID (should be laid-out) to lookup in the atlas
      Returns:
      the cached glyph sprite or null if the glyph has nothing to render

    • getCurrentTexture

      @RenderThread public int getCurrentTexture(int maskFormat)

      @RenderThread public int getCurrentTexture(Font font)
